full_summary:
### Impede the Reed – Mechanical Phragmites Harvesting 

#### Solicitation Number: 5P300-22-0107/A

#### Introduction

Parks Canada is inviting qualified contractors to participate in the Impede the Reed – Mechanical Phragmites Harvesting tender. This project involves the mechanical harvesting of Phragmites within the Georgian Bay Islands National Park. 

#### Description of the Work

The work under this contract primarily includes:

*   Cutting 5.3 hectares of Phragmites within the firm service area
*   Collecting, transporting, and depositing cut biomass from the work site to shoreline disposal locations on Beausoleil Island

#### Period of Contract/Delivery Date

The period of the Contract begins on the date of Contract and ends on March 31, 2023, inclusive. The work identified at Annex A – Figure 3 as the “firm service” is to be performed from date of Contract to October 31, 2022, inclusive.

#### Options for Contractual Obligations

The Contractor grants to Canada the irrevocable option to extend the term of the Contract by up to two (2) additional one (1) year periods under the same conditions.

#### Security Requirement

There is no security requirement associated with this solicitation.

#### Site Visit

It is recommended that Bidders or their representatives visit the work site. Arrangements have been made for the site visit to be held on August 23, 2022, at 2611 Honey Harbour Rd, Muskoka Rd. 5, Honey Harbour, ON P0E 1E0 - Georgian Bay Islands National Park.

#### Preparing a Bid

*   Potential Bidders must obtain the contract documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service through the Government of Canada's tendering service at [www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders](https://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders).
*   Contract documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.  
*   All other contracts terms and conditions are specified in the contract document. 

#### Closing Date

The bid solicitation closes on **September 8, 2022, 2:00:00 PM (EDT)**. 

#### Bidder Enquiries

Bidders may address technical and contractual enquires to the Contracting Officer. To ensure timely response, enquiries must be received at least five (5) calendar days prior to the closing date.
